job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: Each year, millions of people go on leave in the United States. Due to poor work-life balance, being passed over for promotions, a lack of support from management, and mismanaged leave in general, 34% of them won't return to work. People Teams do a great job serving their people, but managing leave at scale can be increasingly difficult and lead to a bad experience for employees, managers, and HR. We’re fixing that, and we need your help. The opportunity: TiLT is looking for a Software Engineer to help build and scale our backend infrastructure while shipping high-quality products. Working alongside our CTO and product teams, you’ll have an opportunity to lead the design and development of new features, contribute to the platform that powers TiLT’s leave management product, and ultimately shape our growing engineering culture. What success looks like: Help define the future of and contribute directly to TiLT’s core platform and infrastructure. Partner with Product & Design teams to inform the UI/UX of our frontend web applications. Build the next generation of TiLT’s data ingestion and payment computation infrastructure. Collaborate with our CTO to help drive the development of our private API service feature. Contribute to the improvement of our customer onboarding flow. Borrow from your experience to help us level up our team’s technology and processes as we scale and iterate rapidly. Be a steward of privacy by design and software quality principles. Be a core member of a multidisciplinary team focused on shipping an impactful product and features for our customers. Build clean, well tested, high quality front end code. What we’re looking for: Ability to build high-quality software products from ideation to ship at scale. Experience operating cross functionally with Engineering, Product, and Customer Success teams. Someone who can own and drive technical decisions with a grounding in solving problems for our customers and business. Working knowledge of backend services and RESTful APIs. 3+ years of experience using Python in a production environment. Experience with Django or Flask in a production environment. Familiarity with Typescript, NextJS, or hosting & monitoring a production React Application. Experience using a state management framework such as Context / Redux / MobX. Experience coaching and mentoring junior engineers. Bonus if you have FMLA, HRIS, or labor law domain experience. Here’s how we take care of our people: 100% healthcare coverage for our employees Medical & Caregiver Leave 12 weeks of parental Leave Compassionate Leave - up to 2 weeks Flexible work-life balance What we do TiLT's tech-enabled platform manages the entire lifecycle before, during and after leave to help companies retain top talent, improve employee engagement and ultimately improve employees' health and wellness. Our mission is big: reimagine leave in the workplace to create a better world. One that’s better for business and better for humans. We’re backed by top-tier investors including Rockies Venture Club, Techstars Ventures, Matchstick Ventures and awesome angel investors. How we think about diversity We try to make sure the diversity of our customers is reflected in the team that serves them. Because when we include people of all races, genders, sexual orientations, ages, and identities — we end up building a better experience for everyone who uses TiLT. We know we need to be intentional in our hiring practices in order to overcome systemic biases we may be blind to. So, if your lived experience has given you a unique perspective on business, startups, or any other aspect of our business – even if you don’t meet all the requirements – let us know, and we’ll make sure your application gets the attention it deserves.
